text: Colmar is a commune in Alsace in north-eastern France, in the Haut-Rhin department, of which it is a prefecture. It is in the Grand Est region. ==Geography== Colmar is in the north of the Haut-Rhin department. It is in the plain of Alsace, to the east of the Vosgues mountains. The Lauch river, a tributary of the Ill river, flows through the commune. It has an area of . Its average altitude is ; at the city hall, the altitude is . The distances from Colmar to other cities are: * Paris, the national capital - ; * Strasbourg, the regional capital - ; * Marseille - ; * Lyon - ; * Reims - ; * Bordeaux - ; * Toulouse - ; * Montpellier - ; * Nice - . Colmar and its neighboring communes The commune of Altkirch is surrounded by the following communes: ===Climate=== The area around Colmar, at an altitude of about , is characterized by climates with few extremes of temperature. The Köppen climate classification type for the climate at Colmar is a "Marine West Coast Climate" and of the subtype "Cfb". The average amount of precipitation for the year in Colmar is . The month with the most precipitation on average is June with of precipitation. The month with the least precipitation on average is February with an average of . The average temperature for the year in Colmar is . The warmest month, on average, is July with an average temperature of . The coolest month on average is January, with an average temperature of . ==Population== The inhabitants of Colmar are known, in French, as Colmariens (women: Colmariennes). With a population of 68,784, Colmar has a population density of inhabitants/km2. This urban area is the centre of the metropolitan area of Colmar, formed by 39 communes with a population of 129,678 inhabitants and an area of . ==Administration== Colmar is the prefecture of the Haut-Rhin department since 1800. It is the capital of the Colmar-Ribeauvillé arrondissement and is also the administrative centre () of 2 cantons: # Colmar-1, formed with a part of Colmar and the commune Ingersheim, with 44,524 inhabitants (2014). # Colmar-2, formed with a part of Colmar and 12 communes, with 51,221 inhabitants (2014). It is part of the intercommunality Colmar Agglomération. === Twin towns === Colmar is twinned with: * Schongau, Bavaria, Germany * Lucca, Italy * Princeton, United States * Győr, Hungary * Eisenstadt, Austria * Sint-Niklaas, Belgium * Vale of White Horse, United Kingdom ==Gallery== File:ColmarFrance.jpg|The Little Venice neighbourhood, Colmar.
